rtega_mnemonic:
某某RScertain thing or person
  • a kind of tree 木 with a sweet 甘 fruit; also looks like a person
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: The sweet 甘 fruit of a certain tree 木
purpleculture_examples:
某些 [ mǒu xiē ]: some; certain (things)
某某 [ mǒu mǒu ]: so-and-so; such-and-such
某人 [ mǒu rén ]: someone; a certain person; some people; I (self-address after one's surname)
某事 [ mǒu shì ]: something; a certain matter
某物 [ mǒu wù ]: something
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 甘 [ gān ] sweet, tasty; willing
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
heisig_chinese_memo: A generic person (a 'such and such', or, 'so and so') is described here as having body sort of like a tree trunk and head sort of like a wicker basket.
heisig_constituent: so-and-so, sweet, wicker basket, picnic basket, tree, wood
heisig_story: The key word here refers to the adjective for an unspecified person or thing. Its elements: wicker basket . . . tree.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: so-and-so, one, a certain, that person
koohiiStory1: I had the same idea as fuabrisu. A generic person is described here as having body sort of like a tree trunk and head sort of like a wicker basket.
koohiiStory2: Two girls with a lollipop in a tree gossiping´ so-and so did this.´ ´really? so-and what did she do´ ´ o she is sooo wrong..´.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you think a tree looks sweet you have to be certain before you bite into it. Trees are really hard, and usually pretty bitter (believe me) so if you don't want a mouthful of broken teeth, sap, and sadness, you really need to be sure it's the one before you start munching.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Which tree do you think is sweet? That one? Or that one? Are you absolutely certain? I hope you are!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you really want to be certain, and not just guess, take out your bowling (ぼう) ball and roll it as hard as you can into the tree. If its the right one it will let out a sweet smell, if it's not the tree will punch you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: So now let me ask you again, are you certain, or would you like to try the bowling ball test?
Ru_Meaning: so-and-so, one, a certain, that person
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 媒 (なこうど、バイ посредник, сват).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the sweet (甘) tree (木) is a certain tree
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A generic person (a 'such and such', or, 'so and so') is described here as having body sort of like a tree trunk and head sort of like a wicker basket.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from "甘" from " wood ", "甘" is like a population, one point indicates one thing in the mouth to express taste. The whole word means that there are sweet and sour plums on the tree. "Shuowen": "Some, sour fruit. From the wood from the sweet. Que. Mu, the ancient text is from the mouth." Xu Hao's "Shuowen Duan Annotation": """ is the character of the present sour fruit "mei", because Under the guise of "who and such", it was used by the meaning of "mei"." "Yu Pian": "some, ancient plum character." See " mei ". "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "This fault means that the meaning is sour and the form is sweet, but it is not explained." "Shuowen" pointed out that the original meaning of " mou " is "sour fruit", but it lacks the meaning of "甘". Duan Yucai believes that the meaning of the word is acid, and the shape of the character is " sweet ". In fact, Zhu Junsheng has pointed out that the original meaning of the word " gan " may also refer to various flavors, but later it specifically refers to sweetness.

" XX " is the original text of "梅". Since the word " XX " was borrowed as someone's " XX ", the word " mu " was added to make the character "楳", which means plum tree. "楳" is in " Suo Wen" is the " plum " of the classical, and later " Mei " with fewer words, and multi-purpose " plum " word.

The word " mou " is used as the original meaning to mean plum, which was first seen on bamboo slips in the Warring States Period. Xinyang Changtaiguan No. 2 Tomb 2 Group Jane 21: "A bottle of certain (mei) sauce" refers to plum sauce. "Baoshan Chujian" Jane 255: "Mi Mou (Mei) One".

Jin Wentong's false name is " mou ", which means to seek painting, and it means "Zhou Gong (mou)". It is also used as a negative word to admonish Gui: "Female (Ru) XX does not (have) heard of it again", which means that you shouldn't be blind. The bird-shaped sacred bird from M2002 in Yicheng Dahekou Cemetery: "Yu Moufu called the public fate", which means that I will not disobey the public's order.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period also expressed someone's " something ", and "Jiudian Chujian" No. 43: "With (today) a certain will want to eat".
humanum_short_description_en: From the Bronze " Gan " from the " wood " represents the tree grows sweet and sour plum, is " plum " of the word. The original meaning is plum and sour plum.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「甘」從「木」，「甘」象人口，一點指示口含一物，以表示味道。全字表示樹上有酸酸甜甜的梅果。《說文》：「某，酸果也。从木从甘。闕。槑，古文某从口。」徐灝《說文段注箋》：「『某』即今酸果『梅』字，因假借為『誰某』，而為借義所專，遂假『梅』為之。」《玉篇》：「某，古梅字。」參見「梅」。《說文解字注》：「此闕，謂義訓酸而形從甘，不得其解也。」《說文通訓定聲》：「五味之美皆曰甘」。《說文》指出「某」的本義為酸果，但缺釋從「甘」之意；段玉裁認為義訓是酸，而字形從「甘」，不得其解，所以才闕而不釋。其實朱駿聲已指出，「甘」字的初義可能兼指各種味道，後來才專指甘甜。

　　「某」是「梅」的初文，由於「某」字被借用為某人之「某」，所以加「木」造「楳」字，表示梅樹，「楳」在《說文》中是「梅」的古文，後來「楳」字少用，而多用「梅」字。

　　「某」字用作本義，表示梅子，最早見於戰國竹簡。信陽長臺觀2号墓2組簡21：「一瓶某（梅）醬」，指梅子醬。《包山楚簡》簡255：「蜜某（梅）一」。

　　金文通假為「謀」，表示謀畫，禽簋：「周公某（謀）」。又用作否定詞，諫簋：「女（汝）某不又（有）聞」，表示你不要沒有見聞。翼城大河口墓地M2002所出鳥形盉：「余某弗稱公命」，表示我不會不符合公的命令。

　　戰國竹簡又表示某人之「某」，《九店楚簡》簡43：「含（今）日某將欲食」。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「甘」從「木」，表示樹上長着酸酸甜甜的梅子，是「梅」的本字。本義為梅子、酸梅。

金文從「 甘 」從「 木 」，「 甘 」象人口，一點指示口含一物，以表示味道。全字表示樹上有酸酸甜甜的梅果。《說文》：「某，酸果也。从木从甘。闕。槑，古文某从口。」徐灝《說文段注箋》：「『某』即今酸果『梅』字，因假借為『誰某』，而為借義所專，遂假『梅』為之。」《玉篇》：「某，古梅字。」參見「 梅 」。《說文解字注》：「此闕，謂義訓酸而形從甘，不得其解也。」《說文通訓定聲》：「五味之美皆曰甘」。《說文》指出「 某 」的本義為酸果，但缺釋從「 甘 」之意；段玉裁認為義訓是酸，而字形從「 甘 」，不得其解，所以才闕而不釋。其實朱駿聲已指出，「 甘 」字的初義可能兼指各種味道，後來才專指甘甜。 「 某 」是「 梅 」的初文，由於「 某 」字被借用為某人之「 某 」，所以加「 木 」造「 楳 」字，表示梅樹，「 楳 」在《說文》中是「 梅 」的古文，後來「 楳 」字少用，而多用「 梅 」字。 「 某 」字用作本義，表示梅子，最早見於戰國竹簡。信陽長臺觀2号墓2組簡21：「一瓶某（梅）醬」，指梅子醬。《包山楚簡》簡255：「蜜某（梅）一」。 金文通假為「 謀 」，表示謀畫，禽簋：「周公某（謀）」。又用作否定詞，諫簋：「女（汝）某不又（有）聞」，表示你不要沒有見聞。翼城大河口墓地M2002所出鳥形盉：「余某弗稱公命」，表示我不會不符合公的命令。 戰國竹簡又表示某人之「 某 」，《九店楚簡》簡43：「含（今）日某將欲食」。

The whole word means that there are sweet and sour plums on the tree. "Shuowen": "Some, sour fruit. From the wood from the sweet. Que. Mu, the ancient text is from the mouth." Xu Hao's "Shuowen Duan Annotation": """ is the character of the present sour fruit "mei", because Under the guise of "who and such", it was used by the meaning of "mei"." "Yu Pian": "some, ancient plum character." See " mei". "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "This fault means that the meaning is sour and the form is sweet, but it is not explained." "Shuowen" pointed out that the original meaning of " mou" is "sour fruit", but it lacks the meaning of " 甘". Duan Yucai believes that the meaning of the word is acid, and the shape of the character is " sweet". In fact, Zhu Junsheng has pointed out that the original meaning of the word " gan" may also refer to various flavors, but later it specifically refers to sweetness. " XX" is the original text of " 梅". Since the word " XX" was borrowed as someone's " XX", the word " mu" was added to make the character " 楳", which means plum tree. " 楳" is in " Suo Wen" is the " plum" of the classical, and later " Mei" with fewer words, and multi-purpose " plum" word. The word " mou" is used as the original meaning to mean plum, which was first seen on bamboo slips in the Warring States Period. Xinyang Changtaiguan No. 2 Tomb 2 Group Jane 21: "A bottle of certain (mei) sauce" refers to plum sauce. "Baoshan Chujian" Jane 255: "Mi Mou (Mei) One". Jin Wentong's false name is " mou", which means to seek painting, and it means "Zhou Gong (mou)". It is also used as a negative word to admonish Gui: "Female (Ru) XX does not (have) heard of it again", which means that you shouldn't be blind. The bird-shaped sacred bird from M2002 in Yicheng Dahekou Cemetery: "Yu Moufu called the public fate", which means that I will not disobey the public's order. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period also expressed someone's " something", and "Jiudian Chujian" No. 43: "With (today) a certain will want to eat".

某字的基本解释

某
mǒu
代替不明确指出的人、地、事、物等：某人。某处。某国。
自称（代替“我”或名字）：某姓李。

某字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mǒu］
［《廣韻》莫厚切，上厚，明。］
“厶2”的被通假字。
(1)指一定的不明说的人或事物。
(2)用在姓氏后，单指名；或用在“子”字前单指姓；用在“甫”字前单指表字。
(3)指不定的不说明的人或事物。
(4)指代失传的或忘记的人名或时、地等。
(5)自称之词。指代“我”或本名。旧时谦虚的用法。
(6)通“謀”。谋求；谋略。
[②]［méi］
［《集韻》謨杯切，平灰，明。］
“梅1”的古字。

某字的英文翻译

◎ 某
certain, some

某字的康熙字典解释
某字的源字形

某字的起名意思

代词。代替人、时、事、物等，而又不明确指出。

certain
Basic explanation of words
certain
mǒu
Instead of people, places, things, things, etc. that are not clearly pointed out: someone. somewhere. A certain country.
Self-proclaimed (instead of "I" or first name): a certain surname Li.
certain
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [mǒu]
["Guang Yun" Mo thick cut, thick on top, Ming. ]
"厶2" was passed falsely.
(1) Refers to a certain unknown person or thing.
(2) When used after the last name, it only refers to the first name; or when it is used before the word "子", it refers to the surname only; when it is used before the word "甫", it refers to the table word.
(3) Refers to an uncertain person or thing that is not stated.
(4) Refers to a lost or forgotten name, time, place, etc.
(5) Self-proclaimed words. Refers to "I" or real name. The old modest usage.
(6) Through "seeking". Seek;
[②]［méi］
["Ji Yun" Mo cup cut, flat gray, bright. ]
The ancient character of "梅1".
certain

“某”是“梅”的本字,字由“木”、
“廿”构成,会意字。《说文》:“某,酸
果也。”徐灏注箋:“*某”即今酸果
*梅’字。因假借为‘谁某'面为借义
所专,遂假‘梅”为之。”“某”常用作指
示代词,如“某人”、“某地”;还可指代
自己。

簡化字
D DE 某某
(недостаток)
Некоторые мо
(Прилагается) Гомей
небольшой
определенный
писец
Кай
определенный
«Some» - это исходный символ «梅», который состоит из «Wood» и «Ten», что означает слова.
«Шуовэнь»: «Немного, кислые фрукты». Примечание Сюй Хао: «* так» - это текущий характер кислого фрукта * мэй.
Из-за притворства «кто и такой» лицо используется для заимствованного значения, поэтому для него используется фальшивая «мэй». «Некоторые» часто используются как указательные местоимения, например «кто-то» и «некоторые». место "; это также может относиться к самому себе.
ребенок.
Зигувен
Текст
Вся биография
Упрощенные символы
D DE XX
mǒu, méi
I, mǒu
1) некто; некий; некоторый; энный
张某 некто Чжан
某部 энная часть
某地 где-то
某人 некий человек; некто
2) уничижит. я
某受命 я получил Ваш приказ
3) вм. 谋 (план; стремиться)
II, méi
вм. 梅 (абрикос муме)
Radicals: 甘, 木  (sweet, tree)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you think a tree looks sweet you have to be certain before you bite into it. Trees are really hard, and usually pretty bitter (believe me) so if you don't want a mouthful of broken teeth, sap, and sadness, you really need to be sure it's the one before you start munching.
Which tree do you think is sweet? That one? Or that one? Are you absolutely certain? I hope you are!
Reading Mnemonic
If you really want to be certain, and not just guess, take out your bowling (ぼう) ball and roll it as hard as you can into the tree. If its the right one it will let out a sweet smell, if it's not the tree will punch you.
So now let me ask you again, are you certain, or would you like to try the bowling ball test?

木 (дерево), 甘 (сладкий)
Не путать: 媒 (なこうど、バイ посредник, сват).
